org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient
Class ClientEndpointUDP

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient.ClientEndpointUDP
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientEndpoint
 class ClientEndpointUDP
extends Object
implements ClientEndpoint

Wrapper that adds TCP like server handling to the UDP DatagramSocket.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
ClientEndpointUDP(java.net.DatagramSocket, java.lang.String, int), getServerEndpoint(), ClientEndpointUDP.DatagramPacketReceiver

Nested Class Summary
private  class ClientEndpointUDP.DatagramPacketReceiver
          Continuously receives DatagramPacket objects and delegates these to a ServerEndpoint to emulate TCP Socket behavior where a Socket per server receives messages from a connected client.

          Contains the value that is the command sent to the server when making first contact, so that the server knows where to send the UDP messages.

Field Detail

PACKET_BUFFER_SIZE

private static final int PACKET_BUFFER_SIZE
This should probably be tuned at some point to allow for larger datagram packets.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ACK

public static final String ACK
Contains the that is the first value we expect from the server as an acknowledgment answer to '"CONNECT"'.

Value: "ACK".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

CONNECT

public static final String CONNECT
Contains the value that is the command sent to the server when making first contact, so that the server knows where to send the UDP messages.

Value: "CONNECT".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

datagramSocket

private final DatagramSocket datagramSocket
The client socket on which we'll send and receive messages on in the form of UDP datagram packets.

server

private ServerEndpointUDP server
The server endpoint, assigned when first UDP contact has been made. We can't know the address before that, as the server is identified by the UDP packet.

handshakeAcknowledged

private boolean handshakeAcknowledged
When initializing a connection to the server, we're performing a handshake which needs to be acknowledged first. Since UDP does not guarantee the order of incoming message, we might need to buffer unrelated message until the acknowledgment arrives.

bufferQueue

private final LinkedList<DatagramPacket> bufferQueue
This queue buffers incoming messages while the handshake is being confirmed by the server.

Constructor Detail

ClientEndpointUDP

public ClientEndpointUDP(DatagramSocket datagramSocket,
                         String host,
                         int port)
Constructor; starts a new Thread listening for new datagram packets. If a new server sends a message, it will be returned on getServerEndpoint(). In either case the datagram is passed on to the server endpoint.

Parameters:
datagramSocket - A DatagramSocket to listen to UDP messages.
host - The host to which the DatagramPacket objects need to be sent to.
port - The host to which the DatagramPacket objects need to be sent to.
Method Detail

initializeHandshake

private void initializeHandshake(String host,
                                 int port)
Performs a handshake with the server by sending a '"CONNECT"' command. The response '"ACK"' is handled by ClientEndpointUDP.DatagramPacketReceiver.run().

Parameters:
host - The host to which the DatagramPacket objects need to be sent to.
port - The host to which the DatagramPacket objects need to be sent to.

verifyAcknowledgment

private boolean verifyAcknowledgment(DatagramPacket datagramPacket)
Verifies that the server verifies the handshake request with an '"ACK"' reply to an ''. If it isn't, the message will be buffered in bufferQueue until it is.

Parameters:
datagramPacket - The response message from the server that must contain the acknowledgment value.

getServerEndpoint

public ServerEndpoint getServerEndpoint()
Returns a server endpoint in case a datagram packet is received from a previously unknown server. Otherwise, nothing is returning and this method remains blocking (like ServerSocket.accept()) until a server sends a datagram packet.

TCP messages received are inherently coupled to a (server) Socket. To mimic this behavior ClientEndpointUDP keeps track of the first connected server and will assume all future communication is with the same server binding.

Specified by:
getServerEndpoint in interface ClientEndpoint
Returns:
An endpoint that acts similarly for a TCP and UDP server.

isClosed

public boolean isClosed()
Specified by:
isClosed in interface ClientEndpoint
Returns:
DatagramSocket.isClosed()

close

public void close()
Calls DatagramSocket.close()

Specified by:
close in interface ClientEndpoint
